title: DND: What It Means & How to Respond

steps.title: "DND" means "do not disturb" in texting, slang, and social media.
steps.content: "DND" means "do not disturb" in texting, slang, and social media. People use this abbreviation when they donâ€™t wish to be bothered. It communicates that theyâ€™re busy (or in need of alone time), so try not to contact them until they let you know theyâ€™re available. [1] X Research source "DND" is also a privacy feature for smartphones and other digital devices. It temporarily disables incoming calls, texts, and notifications, so many people activate it when theyâ€™re sleeping, studying, or working.

steps.title: Text your loved ones that you have an important event coming up.
steps.content: Text your loved ones that you have an important event coming up. Do you have a meeting, interview, or exam in the near future? Tell your friends and family about your upcoming schedule, then use "DND" to request privacy during that time. [2] X Research source "Exam happening in 5 minutes, DNDğŸ¤«" "DND, Iâ€™m about to walk in for my interview." "I have a big presentation in the next hour, so DND. Iâ€™ll let you know when Iâ€™m free." "Walking into a meeting right now, so Iâ€™m setting my phone to DND. Donâ€™t text me until 8."

steps.title: Let everyone know your phone is on "Do Not Disturb" mode.
steps.content: Let everyone know your phone is on "Do Not Disturb" mode. If youâ€™re using DND mode, set up an auto-reply message to inform people that youâ€™re busy. On iPhones, you can set this up in your Driving Focus (it can be used even if you're not driving!). Go to Settings > Focus > + > Driving > Customize Focus . Tap on Auto-Reply and choose All Contacts , then edit your auto-reply message. If you have an Android or Samsung, install the SMS Auto Reply app to set up your response to any incoming texts. "Currently using DND mode, so I wonâ€™t see your message until the morning. Sweet dreamsğŸ˜´" "Hey, Iâ€™m driving with Do Not Disturb mode on. Iâ€™ll see your message as soon as I reach my destination." "Iâ€™m currently on vacation in Hawaii, and my phone is on Do Not Disturb. Iâ€™ll be back in the office on 3/31."

steps.title: Caption your vacation post with "DND" (and some fun emojis).
steps.content: Caption your vacation post with "DND" (and some fun emojis). Whether youâ€™re on a tropical island or in the countryside, caption your vacation photos with "DND" to let everyone know you're living your best life. If you want to convey more personality and playfulness, feel free to add some fun emojis. "DNDğŸ”‡" "Time to rest & relax. DND." "The mountains are calling meâ€¦ DNDğŸš«"

steps.title: Reply with "Okay" to let them know you received their message.
steps.content: Reply with "Okay" to let them know you received their message. While you donâ€™t have to respond to "DND," you can send a simple message to affirm you heard the other person. Itâ€™s more polite than replying with a Tapback (or leaving them on read), and it ends the conversation on a positive note. "Okay, see you soon!" "Okie dokieğŸ”‡" "Ok, talk to you later." "Oooh, gotchağŸ‘"

steps.title: Wish them luck if they have an upcoming event.
steps.content: Wish them luck if they have an upcoming event. If your loved one has an upcoming meeting, exam, or interview, send them a supportive message to boost their confidence. You can send them a simple "Good luck" or ask them to text you when they're available. "Good luck, you got this!" "Break a leg!" "Youâ€™re going to crush your presentation!" "No matter what happens, I'm so proud of you! Let me know how it goes!!"

steps.title: Respond to their social media post with a positive message.
steps.content: Respond to their social media post with a positive message. If your friend posts a photo with the caption "DND," comment an uplifting message to be supportive . You can compliment the scenery, stress how much you miss them, or express light-hearted jealousy. "Look at you living your best life!" "Come home soon, I miss you." "OmgggğŸ˜" "So jealous of that view!" "Wish I was there with youğŸ¥º"

steps.title: Do Not Delete
steps.content: Do Not Delete At work, DND can be a request to keep certain files and documents on the computer. This abbreviation isnâ€™t super common in conversation, but your boss or colleague might send you a text to save what you're working on. [3] X Research source "Flag that PDF as DND so no one accidentally deletes it." "Good job on the paper. Can you mark it as DND so we can reference it in the future?"

steps.title: Dungeons and Dragons
steps.content: Dungeons and Dragons Dungeons & Dragons is a popular role-playing game with multiple players. While most people abbreviate it as "D&D," some interchange it with "DND." If youâ€™re unsure whether your friend is asking you to play Dungeons and Dragons , ask them directly or send a dragon emoji to get clarification. [4] X Research source "ğŸ‰ğŸ²?" "Do Not Disturb, or Dungeons & Dragons?ğŸ˜‚"

steps.title: Drunk and Disorderly
steps.content: Drunk and Disorderly If you cause a public disturbance after drinking too much alcohol, you can be charged with drunk and disorderly conduct. Also known as "disturbing the peace," disorderly conduct includes loitering, fighting, and being unreasonably noisy. [5] X Research source "Did you see him last night? He started screaming in the middle of the street! Iâ€™m so surprised he wasnâ€™t arrested for being drunk and disorderly." "Last night was crazy. How did we not get charged for being DND?"
